result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Holland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua J Holland in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Joshua J Holland in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - In 15CF762 Plea to Ct 2, DRI Ct 1 and 3-6; and In 15CM1181 Plea to Ct 1
Rights given
P - No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt Ct 2 15CF762, DRI Cts 1 and 3-6. DRI 15CM1811. PSI ordered. 

Def - Req bond modified to $500 cash, no obj to GPS
St - Object to modification
BTC: Motion for bond modification granted - $500 cash. House arrest w/GPS. Must live with mother and follow all house rules. Can leave for court. PSI interview and atty appointments, medical appts and school. Attend school daily as scheduled. No contact with any gang member. All previous conditions remain in place. Defendant may only be released from custody to mother. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $850.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim, ADT and ST and 1638 Taylor Ave Racine WI (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Joshua J Holland in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
